Sentencas: We use photo-electrons as a non-contact probe to measure local electrical potentials in a solid-oxide electrochemical cell.
Titulo: Measuring individual overpotentials in an operating solid-oxide electrochemical cell

Sentencas: We characterize the cell in operando at near-ambient pressure using spatially-resolved X-ray photoemission spectroscopy.
Titulo: Measuring individual overpotentials in an operating solid-oxide electrochemical cell

Sentencas: The overpotentials at the interfaces between the Ni and Pt electrodes and the yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte are directly measured.
Titulo: Measuring individual overpotentials in an operating solid-oxide electrochemical cell

Sentencas: The method is validated using electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Measuring individual overpotentials in an operating solid-oxide electrochemical cell

Sentencas: Using the overpotentials, which characterize the cell's inefficiencies, we compare without ambiguity the electro-catalytic efficiencies of Ni and Pt, finding that on Ni H(2)O splitting proceeds more rapidly than H(2) oxidation, while on Pt, H(2) oxidation proceeds more rapidly than H(2)O splitting.
Titulo: Measuring individual overpotentials in an operating solid-oxide electrochemical cell
